page.title: 06Employment
page.content: This reflects the major changes in the community.Up to the 1950,and boosted by the coming of Justin Brook Fruit Farms ithe 1930s,most of the community were employed on the land or in local "service" industries.After World War 2 and with the coming of electricity and water,development was rapid.Road improvements,cheaper motoring both meant residents could work in the towns and have wider choice for their needs. The result is only 1 local shop and few local services.The villagers arrive prepared to travel to work in towns. Farming today is highly mechanized so far fewer men are needed.One farm with 226.3 hectares now only employes 3 men. There is some seasonal work on a casual basis but only a small proportion of the total work force can be employed in the village.Most of this work is on the fruit farms.
